snippet: The state must limit its number of prisoners as the Supreme Court has ordered.
abstract: Editorial contends that there is no reason that California cannot meet the limit set by the Supreme Court on the number of state prisoners; urges the state Legislature to take up a proposal that has been put on the fall ballot by citizens of the state, which is a principled and creative approach to reducing overcrowding in its prisons.
lead_paragraph: The state must limit its number of prisoners as the Supreme Court has ordered.
